entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as the one who has come to the conclusion about Hokey's involvement in the death.

entities.name: hokey
entities.description: Hokey is a house-elf who is accused of putting poison in her mistress's cocoa.

entities.name: voldemort
entities.description: Voldemort is mentioned as the one who modified Hokey's memory to take the blame for the death.

entities.name: morfin
entities.description: Morfin is a person whose memory was also modified by Voldemort.

relationships.description: Dumbledore concludes that Hokey's memory was modified by Voldemort.
Voldemort modified Hokey's memory to take the blame for the death.
Dumbledore compares Hokey's case with Morfin's, where Voldemort also modified their memories.
